item.title: Julie add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I like to have a martini, Two at the very most. After three I'm under the table, after four I'm under my host." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Julie add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "If I didn't care for fun and such, I'd probably amount to much. But I shall stay the way I am, Because I do not give a damn." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Julie add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "If you want to know what God thinks of money, just look at the people he gave it to." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Julie add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Julie add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "By the time you swear you're his, Shivering and sighing. And he vows his passion is, Infinite, undying. Lady make note of this -- One of you is lying." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Julie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Death must be so beautiful. To lie in the soft brown earth, with the grasses waving above one's head, and listen to silence. To have no yesterday, and no tomorrow. To forget time, to forgive life, to be at peace." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Julie add a quote by Miranda July
item.description: "This pain, this dying, this is just normal. This is how life is. In fact, I realize, there never was an earthquake. Life is just this way, broken, and I am crazy for dreaming of something else." -- Miranda July

item.title: Julie add a quote by Miranda July
item.description: "Do you have doubts about life? Are you unsure if it's worth the trouble? Look at the sky: that is for you. Look at each person's face as you pass on the street: those faces are for you. And the street itself, and the ground under the street and the ball of fire underneath the ground: all these things are for you. They are as much for you as they are for other people. Remember this when you wake up in the morning and think you have nothing. Stand up and face the east. Now praise the sky and praise the light within each person under the sky. It's okay to be unsure. But praise, praise, praise." -- Miranda July

item.title: Julie add a quote by Miranda July
item.description: "Are you angry? Punch a pillow. Was it satisfying? Not hardly. These days people are too angry for punching. What you might try is stabbing. Take an old pillow and lay it on the front lawn. Stab it with a big pointy knife. Again and again and again. Stab hard enough for the point of the knife to go into the ground. Stab until the pillow is gone and you are just stabbing the earth again and again, as if you want to kill it for continuing to spin, as if you are getting revenge for having to live on this planet day after day, alone." -- Miranda July

item.title: Julie add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "It's pain that changes our lives." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Julie add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "[her] mind blackens. The blackness is not a thought, but if it could be pressed into a thought, if a chemical from a dropper could be dripped onto it causing its color and essence to become visible, it would take the shape of this sentence: Why does no one want me?" -- Steve Martin

item.title: Julie add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "She has learned that her body is precious and it mustn't be offered carelessly ever again, as it holds a direct connection to her heart." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Julie add a quote by Sara Teasdale
item.description: "You will recognize your own path when you come upon it because you will suddenly have all the energy and imagination you will ever need." -- Sara Teasdale

item.title: Julie add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Julie add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "Let us be elegant or die! --Amy" -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Julie add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "My child, the troubles and temptations of your life are beginning, and may be many; but you can overcome and outlive them all if you learn to feel the strength and tenderness of your Heavenly Father as you do that of your earthly one. The more you love and trust Him, the nearer you will feel to Him, and the less you will depend on human power and wisdom. His love and care never tire or change, can never be taken from you, but may become the source of lifelong peace, happiness, and strength. Believe this heartily, and go to God with all your little cares, and hopes, and sins, and sorrows, as freely and confidingly as you come to your mother." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Julie add a quote by Kurt Cobain
item.description: "I'd rather be hated for who I am, than loved for who I am not." -- Kurt Cobain

item.title: Julie add a quote by Kurt Cobain
item.description: "Wanting to be someone else is a waste of who you are" -- Kurt Cobain

item.title: Julie add a quote by Denis Johnson
item.description: "Think of being curled up and floating in a darkness. Even if you could think, even if you had an imagination, would you ever imagine its opposite, this miraculous world the Asian Taoists call the "Ten Thousand Things"? And if the darkness just got darker? And then you were dead? What would you care? How would you eve know the difference?" -- Denis Johnson

item.title: Julie add a quote by Denis Johnson
item.description: "I’d been staying at the Holiday Inn with my girlfriend, honestly the most beautiful woman I’d even known, for three days under a phony name, shooting heroin. We made love in the bed, ate steaks at the restaurant, shot up in the john, puked, cried, accused one another, begged of one another, forgave, promised, and carried one another to heaven." -- Denis Johnson

item.title: Julie add a quote by Denis Johnson
item.description: "How could I do it, how could a person go that low? And I understand your question, to which I reply, Are you kidding? That's nothing. I'd been much lower than that. And I expected to see myself do worse." -- Denis Johnson

item.title: Julie add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "Death may beget life, but oppression can beget nothing other than itself." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Julie add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "There either is or is not, that’s the way things are. The colour of the day. The way it felt to be a child. The saltwater on your sunburnt legs. Sometimes the water is yellow, sometimes it’s red. But what colour it may be in memory, depends on the day. I’m not going to tell you the story the way it happened. I’m going to tell it the way I remember it." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Julie add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "If only we'd stop trying to be happy, we could have a pretty good time." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Julie add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "The women one meets - what are they but books one has already read? You're a library of the unknown, the uncut. Upon my word I've a subscription." -- Henry James

item.title: Julie add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "Live all you can: it's a mistake not to. It doesn't matter what you do in particular, so long as you have had your life. If you haven't had that, what have you had?" -- Henry James

item.title: Julie add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "And the day came when the risk to remain tight in a bud was more painful than the risk it took to blossom." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Julie add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Hope is the thing with feathers That perches in the soul And sings the tune without the words And never stops at all." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Julie add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "Certain motherfuckers think they can fuck with my shit, but you can't kill the Rooster. You might can fuck him up some times, but, bitch, nobody kills the motherfucking Rooster. You know what I'm saying?" -- David Sedaris

item.title: Julie add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life." -- Albert Camus
